response.answer_text: Well... yes, in his own way. Music was his religion: "I was young, fancy free, and Tibetan Buddhism appealed to me at that time. I thought, ‘There’s salvation.’ It didn’t really work. Then I went through Nietzsche, Satanism, Christianity… pottery, and ended up singing. It’s been a long road" If you ask if he believed in any God then the answers is most likely "no": "I’m not quite an atheist and it worries me. There’s that little bit that holds on: Well, I’m almost an atheist. Give me a couple of months." And few lines from his song "Seven":"The Gods forgot they made meSo I forgot them tooI listen to their shadowsI play among their graves" Many people find here reference to Nietzsche famous quote: “God is dead.”
You're so lucky he answered exactly that question on an interview from 1973!
